issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Fix TestAclCommands after merging HADOOP-10338 patch.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: We can no longer get the correct FileStatus of the root inode "/" from the Globber.
fields.summary: Cannot get the FileStatus of the root inode from the new Globber

comments.body:
Thanks to [~atm] for figuring out that this is the globber after all.  It turns out that there is a bug which causes the Globber to return a bogus {{FileStatus}} when asked about root.  This doesn't affect what I was testing (i.e. that we can chmod or chown the root directory).

So during my test, the root *was* actually being modified, but I just couldn't see it because the globber continued to tell me that it had the same status as before.  atm wrote a program which bypassed the globber and proved that the inode was being modified after all.
